properties.title: The Ant Task for the Castor DDL Generator
properties.author: Werner Guttmann
properties.abstract: Describes how to use the Ant task for the Castor DDL Generator and what is currently supported.

body.title: Using the Ant task for the Castor DDL Generator

section.title: Castor DDL generator Ant task
section.p: An alternative to using the command line as shown in the previous section, the Castor DDL Generator Ant Task can be used to call the DDL generator for class generation. The only requirement is that the castor-<version>-anttasks.jar must be on the CLASSPATH.

section.title: Configuration
section.p: Please find below the complete list of parameters that can be set on the Castor source generator.

crow.td: The name of the Castor JDO mapping file to use as input for DDL generation.
The name of the DDL file to be generated.
The name of database engine to generate DDL for.
Name of a custom (global) properties file to be used during DDL generation.
Name of a custom database specific properties file to be used during DDL generation.

section.p: Alternatively to specifying the file property, it is possible to work with a nested <FileSet> element or with the dir property.

section.title: Example
section.p: Below is an example of how to use this task from within an Ant target definition named 'castor:ddl:src':
section.code-panel:
<target name="castor:ddl:src" depends="init" description="Generate a DDL script from a JDO mapping file.">
<taskdef name="castor-ddlgen" classname="org.castor.anttask.CastorDDLGenTask" classpathref="castor.class.path" /> <mkdir dir="generated" /> <castor-ddlgen file="src/main/resources/mapping.xml" ddlFileName="target/generated/ddl/mapping.sql" databaseEngine="mysql"/> </target>
